elements.text:
Your boss tells everyone that tomorrow you'll divide into small groups to plan out new work projects. She also says that you'll have to pick your group, but you realize you don't have any close friends in your workplace.

Here are some thoughts that might pop into mind:

texts: I'll make good contributions to the group discussion.
I'll end up in a group somehow and it will be fine, even if it's not my first choice.
Everyone will pick their group before I get there and I won't be able to find a group.
People will be happy to work with me.
I might make a comment that the group thinks is dumb, but they'll probably forget what I said after the discussion.
